channel.title: Posts on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Login vs Sign-in
item.description: Login vs Sign-in Use Sign-in (noun, adjective), Sign in (verb) Do not use Sign up; instead, use Create an account References AP vs. Chicago Style Guides: Looks like the AP Style guide is more casual, thus better fits with our “conversational voice” Ref: AP vs. Chicago style: the key differences you should know - Lingoda Mailchimp Welcome to the Mailchimp Content Style Guide | Mailchimp Content Style Guide Uses: login (noun, adjective), log in (verb) Google Prefers: sign-in (noun) and sign in (verb) sign-out (noun or adjective), sign out (verb) Does NOT allow: log in, signin, sign into, sign-on, sign on Microsoft Use sign in or `sign out instead.
